text: We all have a carbon footprint. I just don't like the media negativity towards bitcoin and MSM articles on it are notoriously erroneous about a great many things. When I see people slate bitcoin I always assume it is because they missed out on making money from it. We should all be a lot more worried about how governments and the current banking system are shafting us financially. This after all was (apparently) the reason that bitcoin was created. Maybe bitcoin itself is not the solution and maybe it will go to zero one day but it is VERY poorly understood by the general populace and MSM journos. For sure the majority of crypto "projects" are utter junk and many people will lose money from it. But many people lose money from gambling in the same way. Greed drives us to invest in such things in the same way that greed drives a lot of people to gamble.

text: On the Football Index story: I encountered one of their senior people at a dinner for people in senior positions in London tech firms (for those who understand such things: back then I was a CTO of a scrappy healthcare startup, these days I'm just a lowly SDM in a FAANG), and he was talking about how tough he was finding it. Digging a bit I discovered he had moral questions about how some in the business behaved and wanted advice. The moment I mentioned I was knowledgable about exchanges and trading on sports markets and that I was mates with some of the data guys at City Football Group, he clammed up. Seems like there was more going on there than even I realised, perhaps.

elements.text: On the Football Index story: I encountered one of their senior people at a dinner for people in senior positions in London tech firms (for those who understand such things: back then I was a CTO of a scrappy healthcare startup, these days I'm just a lowly SDM in a FAANG), and he was talking about how tough he was finding it. Digging a bit I discovered he had moral questions about how some in the business behaved and wanted advice. The moment I mentioned I was knowledgable about exchanges and trading on sports markets and that I was mates with some of the data guys at City Football Group, he clammed up. Seems like there was more going on there than even I realised, perhaps.

text: That was back in 2019 I think. I don't think I marked it as possible ponzi in my head, but I decided to keep my money away because _any_ moral behaviour questions at that level (even if it's being an arse to subordinates), is enough to make me worry about integrity
